sentence: 1 |||  ||| 0.1 ||| Objective: To study whether emergent intracoronary autologous bone marrow cell transplantation (BMT) is applicable for the treatment of acute myocardial infarction (AMI).

sentence: 50 ||| DISCUSSION ||| 4.2 ||| In a previous randomised study, Wollert et al 8 showed that intracoronary transplantation of autologous bone marrow cells during the early postinfarction period (within 4-8 days after symptom onset) improved global LVEF.
content: intracoronary transplantation of autologous bone marrow cells during the early postinfarction period (within 4-8 days after symptom onset) improved global LVEF
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 6 |||  ||| 0.6 ||| Conclusion: Emergent intracoronary transplantation of bone marrow mononuclear cells after AMI is practicable, and it improved cardiac function, prevented myocardial remodelling and increased myocardial perfusion at six months' follow up.

label: o.Treatment

sentence: 40 ||| RESULTS ||| 3.8 ||| No angina aggravation, malignant diseases and substantial arrhythmias were found after PCI and intracoronary BMT or bone marrow supernatant transfer either in hospital or during follow up.
